item.title: Episode 27: Visual Studio 2022 - with Kendra Havens
item.description: Not long to go until the release of both .NET 6 and Visual Studio 2022! But if you can’t wait that long - the preview releases of both can be downloaded right now! In this episode, I was joined by Kendra Havens to chat about what’s new and coming! Kendra is a Program Manager on the .NET and Visual Studio team, and we also chatted a bit in this episode about what software development is like internally at Microsoft, and learn that Microsoft face the same struggles as most other companies!
item.author: (Dan Clarke)

item.title: Microsoft no longer signs Windows drivers for Process Hacker
item.description: [German]Brief information, which is already here with me since August 2021, but which I have not yet addressed in the blog. item.title: .NET Hot Reload Support via CLI
item.description: Last week, our blog post and the removal of the Hot Reload capability from the .NET SDK repo led to a lot of feedback from the community. First and foremost, we want to apologize. We made a mistake in executing on our decision and took longer than expected to respond back to the community.
item.author: (Scott Hunter)

item.title: Raspberry Pi 3 Fastboot - Less Than 2 Seconds
item.description: This post tells about my journey on fast-booting a Raspberry Pi 3 (RPI). In addition to that, some optimizations are discussed that can be applied to a Qt (QML) application. At the end, we will have a RPI that boots from power-up to Linux shell in 1.75 seconds, power-up to Qt (QML) application in 2.82 seconds.
